warscrolls.name: Awlrach the Drowner
warscrolls.fluff: A chorus of pitiful, gurgling cries heralds the coming of Awlrach the Drowner, a murderous wraith borne across the lands on a funeral barque. This spectral vessel trails the tormented spirits of those Awlrach betrayed and killed as a mortal, sending them to a briny death in the guise of a friendly boatman. Such cruel and needless murder was pleasing to Nagash, who remade Awlrach as a hunched and towering gheist. He ordered his new servant to row forever across the Mortal Realms, slaying mortals and delivering their souls to the underworlds.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Hero, War Machine, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Passage Through The Underworlds
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Movement Phase
abilities.lore: A master of navigation, Awlrach can drift through the ethereal plane to new locations at will. By the time the foe has discovered his arrival, it is all too late to stop the spectral cargo that made the journey with him.
abilities.declare: If this unit is not in combat, pick a friendly non-**HERO NIGHTHAUNT** unit that is not in combat and is wholly within 12" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Remove this unit and the target from the battlefield, then set them up again on the battlefield wholly within 6" of each other and more than 7" from all enemy units.

abilities.name: Drifting on Spectral Tides
abilities.lore: Little can prevent the Drowner's passage as he drifts throughout the Mortal Realms, seeking fresh victims.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, this unit can immediately use the 'Normal Move' or the 'Retreat' ability as if it were your movement phase.

warscrolls.name: Black Coach
warscrolls.fluff: Driven by a wraith and with the remains of a powerful necromantic being borne in its hearse-like carriage, the Black Coach seeks out sites of great slaughter and suffering. It swells with dark energies as it runs down its targets in explosions of gore, becoming a thrumming locus of Shyishian magic that draws ever more Nighthaunt to the battle.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

melee.name: Relic Bearers' Claws and Ethereal Steeds' Hooves

abilities.name: Nimbus of Power
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
abilities.lore: Dark magic lends the vehicle blurring speed that allows it to disappear, only to reappear in a more advantageous position.
abilities.effect: If this unit is not in combat, remove it from the battlefield and set it up again on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units.

abilities.name: Runaway Coach
abilities.lore: This nightmare‑drawn carriage crushes any who attempt to withstand its momentum.
abilities.declare: If this unit charged this phase, pick an enemy unit within 1" of it to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a D3. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage equal on the target equal to the roll.

abilities.name: Evocation of Death
abilities.lore: The dormant occupant feeds upon the energies of death and uses them to bring spectral champions back from the underworlds.
abilities.declare: If any damage points were allocated to an enemy unit by this unit's combat attacks this turn and that enemy unit was destroyed this turn, pick a friendly non-**UNIQUE NIGHTHAUNT HERO** that has been destroyed.
abilities.effect: Set up a replacement unit wholly within 12" of this unit. The replacement unit can only be set up in combat with enemy units that are in combat with this unit.

warscrolls.name: Bladegheist Revenants
warscrolls.fluff: To be trapped in the jaws of death is to find a frantic, animalistic strength. It is a wild energy born of primal fear, usually accompanied by tight-throated screaming that seeks to deny oblivion with every iota of the sufferer’s soul. The beings known as Bladegheist Revenants are born of that terminal state; indeed, they are trapped in it, unable to escape those final moments.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Thrashing Desperation
abilities.lore: Only the bravest and most determined of charges can get within striking range of the veritable wall of thrashing blades that are the Bladegheist Revenants.
abilities.effect: While this unit contests an objective you control, enemy units cannot finish a charge move within ½" of a model in this unit unless the unmodified charge roll was 7 or more.

warscrolls.name: Cairn Wraith
warscrolls.fluff: The scythe-wielding horrors known as Cairn Wraiths were once mass murderers or cruel executioners, mortals who developed such a taste for killing that upon death their unquiet spirits rose from the underworlds to continue their spree of terror and eager butchery.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Eager Death-dealers
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: The enthusiasm with which this faceless monster swings its cairnoch scythe is such that it drives nearby Grimghast Reapers into an unholy whirlwind of death.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible friendly **Grimghast Reapers** unit wholly within 12" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to wound rolls for the target’s combat attacks for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Chainghasts
warscrolls.fluff: Chainghasts are the servants and enforcers of the Great Oubliette. They are wrought from the soul-stuff of those who beseeched the gods to free them from imprisonment, whether it was justified or otherwise, but did not include Nagash in their entreaties. Their punishment is to retain a dim sliver of awareness, just enough to desire their liberty, yet be bound to obey and assist more powerful gheists in the capturing of mortal souls.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Another Link in the Chain
abilities.lore: Chainghasts act as conduits for Spirit Torments, ensuring all nearby Nighthaunt are invigorated by deathly energies.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. Add 1 to the roll if this unit is wholly within 12" of any friendly **Spirit Torments.** On a 3+, for the rest of the turn, add 1 to hit rolls for combat attacks made by friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units while they are wholly within 12" of this unit.

warscrolls.name: Chainrasps
warscrolls.fluff: Chainrasps are the twisted spirits of transgressors who lived their last months locked in stocks or bound by chain and padlock; others had cruel metal masks nailed to their skulls or heavy weights tied to their limbs. Regardless, they all went to their deaths sure of longed-for oblivion – only to find the ruler of Shyish would alter only their form and not their fate.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Chilling Horde
abilities.lore: Surging forward in a shrieking, wailing mass, Chainrasps are often the first wave of Nighthaunt to assail the foe.
abilities.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly **Chainrasps** units to be the targets.
abilities.effect: Each target can move 6" but cannot end that move in combat.

warscrolls.name: Craventhrone Guard
warscrolls.fluff: The Craventhrone Guard are potent sharpshooters, their projectiles agonisingly drawn from their own essence. Their bolts always seem to find their targets, manifesting in flashes of spectral energy to strike down unsuspecting enemies. This is often to the impotent fury of their master, Kurdoss Valentian, who, denied the chance to rule, takes satisfaction only from combat.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Standard Bearer (1/5), Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Black-hearted Lackeys
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
abilities.lore: These villainous souls unleash a volley of close-range spectral bolts, forcing their opponents backwards as they slink away from combat in good order.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a D3. On a 2+, this unit immediately uses the 'Retreat' ability without any mortal damage being inflicted on it. Then, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

warscrolls.name: Dreadblade Harrows
warscrolls.fluff: Dreadblade Harrows were once noble cavaliers in the service of an officer destined to become a Knight of Shrouds. They stood by whilst their masters betrayed their office, their people, even life itself. Outriders and bodyguards for the monarchy of the dead, they have become the Knights of Regret, riding incorporeal on the winds of Shyish to slay, discorporate and slay again without the slightest remorse.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Cavalry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

melee.name: Ethereal Steed’s Ghostly Hooves and Teeth

abilities.name: Curse of Loyalty
abilities.lore: Dreadblade Harrows are spectral knights who serve as cursed vassals for the commands of their masters.
abilities.effect: If this unit charged this turn, add 3 to the control scores of friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units while they are wholly within 12" of this unit.

abilities.name: Phantasmal Discorporation
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
abilities.lore: Dreadblade Harrows are able to disappear in a spectral mist.
abilities.effect: Remove this unit from the battlefield and set it up again on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units.

warscrolls.name: Dreadscythe Harridans
warscrolls.fluff: Dreadscythe Harridans were healers and alms-givers in life. Upon their deaths, the Great Necromancer wrought a horrific transformation upon them, turning their hands into wicked scythe-blades that would instead lacerate and maim the flesh that they may once have sought to carefully stitch and soothe.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Harrowing Shrieks
abilities.lore: The chilling cries of the Dreadscythe Harridans drive all hope from the hearts of their foes.
abilities.effect: Enemy units cannot be healed or have slain models returned to them while they are in combat with this unit.

warscrolls.name: Glaivewraith Stalkers
warscrolls.fluff: A Glaivewraith Stalker is an unstoppable force. Its long blade always points at the beating heart of its intended victim. Though it drifts slowly towards its quarry, it is inevitable that the hunter’s glaive will one day pierce the chest of its prey.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Musician (1/4), Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Unerring Hunters
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: These spectral hunters will hound their prey until the very end of existence itself.
abilities.effect: For the rest of the turn, each time this unit makes a pile-in move, add 3" to the distance it can move.

warscrolls.name: Grimghast Reapers
warscrolls.fluff: In life, Grimghast Reapers were arch-plotters and cautious schemers who sought to eliminate both rivals and friends without getting a drop of blood on their hands. As wraiths, they have been cursed to kill indiscriminately, reduced to little more than mindless weapons doing the Great Necromancer’s butcher-work.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Reaped Like Corn
abilities.lore: The scythes wielded by these ghostly warriors can be swung in great sweeping arcs, cutting down whole enemy ranks.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit that is within the combat ranges of 5 or more models in this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a number of dice equal to the number of models in the target unit. For each 6, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target. If the target unit has 20 or more models, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target for each 5+ instead.

warscrolls.name: Guardian of Souls
warscrolls.fluff: As mortals, the Guardians of Souls dabbled in the dark arts of undeath, but after realising they trod a perilous downward spiral, they stepped away – a weakness of morality that the Great Necromancer neither forgot nor forgave. Upon their deaths, Nagash remade these former magic users as unliving conduits for the necromantic energy they once spurned.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Wizard (1), Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Nightmare Lantern
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: The cursed light of Nagashizzar bound within a nightmare lantern invigorates the dark souls of any Nighthaunt it illuminates.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit wholly within 12" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, add 1 to wound rolls for the target's attacks for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Hexwraiths
warscrolls.fluff: Upon ghostly steeds, the Hexwraiths ride straight through their foes, turning blood to ice and snatching souls from screaming warriors. Once knights both proud and cruel, these ethereal killers are bound by Nagash to ride eternally, visiting pain and death upon the living in his name.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Cavalry, Champion, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

melee.name: Ethereal Steed’s Ghostly Hooves and Teeth

abilities.name: Spectral Hunters
abilities.lore: As the Hexwraiths ride down their chosen prey, their targets are subject to the phantasmal cavalry’s life-leeching powers.
abilities.declare: If this unit charged this phase, pick an enemy unit within 1" of it to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a D3. On a 2+, inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.

warscrolls.name: Knight of Shrouds
warscrolls.fluff: In life, each Knight of Shrouds was an arch traitor who chose to betray their people in order to delay their own inevitable doom. Nagash interpreted their treason not as cowardice, but as wisdom, seeing value in commanders who understand that to resist his will was madness. Seized upon death and remade into cloaked wraiths, the shroud-knights now lead the hosts of the Nighthaunt into battle.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Stolen Hours
abilities.lore: The bearer of a Sword of Stolen Hours can steal vital energy from a foe and use it to increase their own power.
abilities.effect: Each time this unit uses a **FIGHT** ability, after that **FIGHT** ability has been resolved, **Heal (X)** this unit, where **X** is the number of damage points allocated to enemy units by combat attacks made as part of that **FIGHT** ability.

abilities.name: Infantry Overseer
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a FIGHT ability for this unit
abilities.lore: Each Knight of Shrouds was a mighty general in mortal life and still retains the ability to spur their soldiery to great feats of arms.
abilities.effect: Pick a friendly non-**HERO NIGHTHAUNT INFANTRY** unit that has not used a **FIGHT** ability this turn and is within this unit’s combat range to be the target. The target can be picked to use a **FIGHT** ability immediately after the **FIGHT** ability used by this unit has been resolved. If it is picked to do so, add 1 to hit rolls for the target’s attacks for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Knight of Shrouds on Ethereal Steed
warscrolls.fluff: Many a Knight of Shrouds takes to the battlefield atop an ethereal steed, favouring the speed and killing power of such a baleful creature. They cut a fearsome sight as they order their procession forward in a gushing tide of ectoplasm, spurring them on to take their vengeance against the living.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Cavalry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

melee.name: Ethereal Steed’s Ghostly Hooves and Teeth

abilities.name: Stolen Hours
abilities.lore: The bearer of a Sword of Stolen Hours can steal vital energy from a foe and use it to increase their own power.
abilities.effect: Each time this unit uses a **FIGHT** ability, after that **FIGHT** ability has been resolved, **Heal (X)** this unit, where **X** is the number of damage points allocated to enemy units by combat attacks made as part of that **FIGHT** ability.

abilities.name: Cavalry Overseer
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a FIGHT ability for this unit
abilities.lore: In life, the Knight of Shrouds commanded legions of devoted soldiers. In death, they turn their military genius to the command of shrieking spirits and vengeful phantasms.
abilities.effect: Pick a friendly non-**HERO NIGHTHAUNT CAVALRY** or **WAR MACHINE** unit that has not used a **FIGHT** ability this turn and is within this unit's combat range to be the target. The target can be picked to use a **FIGHT** ability immediately after the **FIGHT** ability used by this unit has been resolved. If it is picked to do so, add 1 to hit rolls for the target's attacks for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Krulghast Cruciator
warscrolls.fluff: The Krulghast Cruciators are nightmarish even amongst the ranks of the undead, and their malice is distilled to an almost elemental sadism. Upon their bent backs, they carry the torture racks that finally broke them, for each Cruciator died during horrific bodily punishment and is keen to visit the same fate upon their foes.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Empowered Through Excruciation
abilities.lore: Krulghast Cruciators draw power from the suffering of those around them, becoming beacons of death magic that make nearby Nighthaunt more difficult to banish.
abilities.effect: Ignore the first damage point that would be allocated to each friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit wholly within 12" of this unit in each phase.

warscrolls.name: Kurdoss Valentian, the Craven King
warscrolls.fluff: The Craven King sits upon a grand throne and wears an imposing crown of dark iron, but these are nothing more than worthless trinkets; Kurdoss Valentian will never know a moment of true glory, for his reign is nothing more than a farce and his gestured commands can be disobeyed without consequence. The twin heralds who hover at their monarch’s side do not regale him with tales of his triumphs but instead mock and denigrate him. Endlessly tormented by their words yet unable to lash out because of the sorceries that bind him, Kurdoss seeks an outlet for his immortal anguish in battle.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Hail Kurdoss! King of Nothing!
abilities.lore: Forever bitter at their liege for being dragged into eternal torment alongside him, the Craventhrone Guard will attempt to deny Valentian even the minuscule solace he derives from crushing foes with his mace.
abilities.declare: If this unit charged this phase, pick a friendly **Craventhrone Guard** unit that is not in combat to be the target.
abilities.effect: The target can immediately use a **SHOOT** ability as if it were your shooting phase, but all of its attacks must target an enemy unit in combat with this unit. The target cannot use **CHARGE** abilities for the rest of the turn.

abilities.name: If I Cannot Rule, None Shall Rule!
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn, Reaction: Opponent declared a command for a unit within 12" of this unit
abilities.lore: In the presence of Kurdoss Valentian’s all-consuming bitterness and the cruel malice of his heralds, the commands of enemy generals turn to dust in their mouths even as they issue them.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, unless your opponent spends 1 additional command point to use that command, the command has no effect, it still counts as having been used and the command points spent to use the command are still lost.

warscrolls.name: Lady Olynder, Mortarch of Grief
warscrolls.fluff: The Mortarch of Grief is an avatar of misery and tragic fate, the dreadful result of Nagash’s experiments to see how much sorrow he could pour into a single soul. Once, she was a cruel mortal queen of the city-state Dolorum, disguising her murderous ambition behind a veil of false tears. Taken by Nagash and remade as a spectral monarch, she now feels everything she professed to and more. Sheer, entropic sorrow radiates from her like a crushing wave, causing plants to wither and warriors to collapse in paroxysms of horror.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Warmaster, Unique, Hero, Wizard (2), Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Mortarch of Grief
abilities.lore: Those foolish enough to confront Lady Olynder soon find their will to fight faltering, replaced with an all-consuming sorrow and despair at the futility of their defiance.
abilities.effect: If the unmodified hit roll or unmodified wound roll for an attack that targets this unit is 1-4, the attack fails and the attack sequence ends.

abilities.name: No Rest for the Wicked
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Hero Phase
abilities.lore: Should the spectral forms of her minions be banished, Lady Olynder will wrench their souls back from the underworlds.
abilities.declare: Pick any number of friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units on the battlefield to be the targets.
abilities.effect: For each target, you can return a number of slain models to it with a combined Health characteristic of up to D3+3.

abilities.name: Grief-stricken
abilities.lore: Lady Olynder’s incantations can cause a pall of misery and utter desolation to descend upon her enemies.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 18" of this unit to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect: Ignore positive modifiers to the target's control score and to hit rolls, wound rolls and save rolls for the target for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Lord Executioner
warscrolls.fluff: Bearing the notched axes of their former trade, the Lord Executioners are sent to claim the lives of those who have escaped the justice of Nagash. The spirits of the wrongfully executed drift around these gheists, crying out their anguish even as they intercept blows meant to harm their slayer. Even in life these figures were held in fear, for their calling was that of the headsman, a role they performed with sadistic relish.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Ghastly Descent
abilities.lore: The axe of a Lord Executioner descends pitilessly on all foolish enough to commit the crime of standing against Nagash's dark justice.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy **INFANTRY** or **CAVALRY HERO** that had any damage points allocated to it this turn by this unit's attacks to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. Add 1 to the roll if the target is a **SENTENCED** unit. On a 5+, the target is automatically destroyed.

abilities.name: Staring Death In The Face
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Combat Phase
abilities.lore: The unwavering stare of a Lord Executioner seems to penetrate the victim's very soul.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, subtract 1 from the Attacks characteristic of the target's melee weapons for the rest of the turn. In addition, if the target is a **HERO**, subtract 5 from the target's control score for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Lord Vitriolic
warscrolls.fluff: An arch poisoner, a Lord Vitriolic creates all manner of potions that they hurl at their foes. Fear-inducing gases, scorching acids and spirit-withering elixirs are all part of their deadly alchemical arsenal each baleful concoction blighting the soul as well as the flesh.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Spectral Alchemy
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: With a chilling cackle, the Lord Vitriolic prepares a specifically abominable elixir to inflict on their unwilling victims, or they spitefully hurl whatever is to hand into the ranks of their foes.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit within 10" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Roll a dice. On a 3+, pick 1 of the following effects or roll two dice and apply both corresponding effects in an order of your choosing, including duplicate effects:

**1 *Phantasmal Solvent:*** If the target has a Move characteristic of'-', inflict 6 mortal damage on the target.

**2 *Acidic Fug:*** Inflict D3 mortal damage on the target.

**3 *Fling Concoctions:*** Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit's Hurled Vial this phase but all attacks made by this unit this phase must target that enemy unit.

**4 *Choking Vapours:*** If the target is a **WIZARD**, subtract 1 from its power level until the start of your next turn.

**5 *Fear-laced Hallucinogen:*** If the target is a **PRIEST**, remove D3 ritual points from it.

**6 *Unholy Prescription:*** Ward rolls cannot be made for the target for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Mortalis Terminexus
warscrolls.fluff: A looming, phantasmal hourglass, the Mortalis Terminexus can distort the very passage of time, its mere presence hastening the advance of the Nighthaunt processions. Should its flow be reversed, it can even undo harm done to the spectral forms of nearby gheists, much to the horror of their enemies.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Manifestation, Endless Spell, Ward (6+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Keeper of Mortality
abilities.lore: A Mortalis Terminexus is a catalyst of deathly magic that invigorates surrounding Nighthaunt.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit within 3" of this **MANIFESTATION** to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Roll a dice. On a 2+, pick 1 of the following effects:

• Add 1 to run rolls and charge rolls for target for the rest of the turn.
• **Heal (3)** the target.

warscrolls.name: Myrmourn Banshees
warscrolls.fluff: In life, the Myrmourn Banshees sought arcane power for their own ends, failing to pay proper respect to the Great Necromancer. In death, they are cursed to consume magic with a horrible hunger, yet they can never use it themselves nor ever be sated. Wherever such energy blooms, the Myrmourn Banshees are drawn in like carrion feasters to a corpse.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Spell-eaters
abilities.phaseDetails: Reaction: Opponent declared a SPELL ability
abilities.lore: These spirits were once wizards, but they failed to pay proper respect to Nagash and are now cursed to agonisingly withstand the magic of others.
abilities.effect: If a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit wholly within 12" of this unit was picked to be the target of that spell, this unit can use the 'Unbind' ability as if it had **WIZARD (1).** Add 1 to the unbinding roll for that ability. If the spell is unbound, inflict D3 mortal damage on the caster.

warscrolls.name: Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead
warscrolls.fluff: All living beings dread the name of Nagash, the God of Undeath. Cruel and tyrannical, the overlord of Shyish intends to conquer the Mortal Realms and transform them into a lifeless Necrotopia, in which not a speck of dust moves unless it is by his will.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Warmaster, Unique, Hero, Monster, Wizard (9), Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Battle Damaged
abilities.effect: While this unit has 10 or more damage points, subtract 3 from its power level.

abilities.name: Hand of Dust
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Any Turn
abilities.lore: Nagash’s touch can turn a foe to a pile of dusty bones in moments.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy **HERO** or **MONSTER** in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Hide a dice in one of your hands or under one of two appropriate containers. Your opponent must pick one of your hands or containers. If they pick the one hiding the dice, this ability has no effect. If they pick the empty one, the target is automatically destroyed.

abilities.name: Supreme Lord of the Undead
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Hero Phase
abilities.lore: Nagash is the undisputed master of all undead creatures.
abilities.declare: Pick a friendly non-**HERO** non-**UNIQUE DEATH** unit that has been destroyed to be the target.
abilities.effect: Set up a replacement unit identical to the target wholly within 12" of this unit and more than 9" from all enemy units.

abilities.name: Invocation of Nagash
abilities.lore: In a storm of morbid sorcery, Nagash blasts his foes’ souls or re-knits his minions’ bodies.
abilities.declare: This unit can cast this spell more than once per phase. Pick a visible unit wholly within 18" of this unit that has not been picked to be the target of this spell this turn to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect:
If the target is an enemy unit, inflict D3 mortal damage on it. If the target is a friendly **DEATH** unit, pick 1 of the following effects:

• Return a number of slain models to the target unit with a combined Health characteristic of up to 3.
• If the target was not set up this turn and is not in combat, it can move up to 3". It cannot move into combat.

abilities.name: The Staff of Power
abilities.lore: Alakanash is capped with gems of purest grave-sand.
abilities.effect: Add 2 to casting rolls for this unit while it has not miscast any spells this turn. If this unit miscasts a spell, ignore the restriction that would stop this unit from casting any more spells this turn.

warscrolls.name: Nexus of Grief
warscrolls.fluff: This dread crypt is possessed of a malign sentience and drenched in amethyst magic. Its stones collapse and reconfigure as it haunts the enemies of Nagash inexorably across lonely moors and hillsides. Appearing as if at will out of the mist and shadow, it is a baleful silhouette in the darkness. Tortured spirits are harboured within its sepulchral confines, emanating grief-stricken malice. Their cries deeply unsettle living foes within earshot or act as a salve to embolden nearby Nighthaunt.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Faction Terrain, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Hungry Crypts
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
abilities.lore: The haunted crypt tears itself apart, only to reassemble itself moments later.
abilities.effect: Remove this terrain feature from the battlefield and set it up again on the battlefield within 3" of a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit, more than 3" from all objectives and enemy units, more than 1" from all terrain features and more than 12" from all other friendly **Nexuses of Grief**.

abilities.name: Awful Refashioning
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Any Turn
abilities.lore: The spirits locked within the Nexus of Grief are agonisingly transformed into cackling gheists, their dreadful wails a brief and bitter balm for nearby Nighthaunt.
abilities.declare: Pick a friendly **Nexus of Grief**, then pick up to 3 friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units wholly within 12" of it to be the targets. You cannot pick the same unit to be a target of this ability more than once per phase.
abilities.effect:
For each target:
• If the target is damaged, **Heal (D3)** the target.
• If the target is not damaged, return a number of slain models to it with a combined Health characteristic of up to D3.

abilities.name: Screams of the Penitent
abilities.lore: The agony inflicted on the souls trapped in a Nexus of Grief is awful to bear witness to.
abilities.effect: Enemy units cannot use commands while they are within 3" of this terrain feature.

warscrolls.name: Pyregheists
warscrolls.fluff: Pyregheists are malevolent spectres obsessed with committing the living to the flames. They represent Nagash’s judgement at its most twisted, for each was in life an embalmer or cremator who sought to preserve the souls of mortals from the Great Necromancer. There can be no greater crime in Nagash’s eyes, and thus he transformed these holy men and women into pyromaniac nightmares.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Champion, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Light A Pyre
abilities.lore: Arcane loci are set ablaze by the Pyregheists, who direct those deadly witchfires with terrible efficacy.
abilities.declare: If this unit is contesting an objective, pick a visible enemy unit within 6" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Roll a D3. On a 2+:
• Inflict an amount of mortal damage on the target equal to the roll.
• Add a number equal to the roll to this unit’s control score for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Reikenor the Grimhailer
warscrolls.fluff: Soaring through the night atop his cadaverous winged steed Kyllaron, the Grimhailer tracks down those who would use magic to extend their mortal lifespans. He is the reaper of souls, but his necrotically empowered scythe is not his deadliest weapon: with a pinch of his bony fingers, the Grimhailer snuffs out a candle atop his steed, instantly extinguishing the animus of one who displeased the Great Necromancer so that their corpse falls lifeless to the ground.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Hero, Wizard (1), Cavalry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Wraithstorm
abilities.lore: Reikenor tears the souls from his victims and commands them to assail their allies.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 12" of this unit to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
abilities.effect: Inflict D3 mortal damage on the target. If any models are slain as a result of this ability, inflict a further D3 mortal damage on the target.

abilities.name: Grim Justice
abilities.lore: Through his arcane powers, Reikenor can sense those who tamper with Nagash’s designs or commit any other sacrilegious act.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to hit rolls and wound rolls for attacks made with this unit's **Fellreaper** if the target is a **WIZARD** or a **PRIEST.**

abilities.name: Corpse Candles
abilities.lore: When preparing to cast a spell by snuffing out the flame of a corpse candle, Reikenor can drain his own or a victim’s essence to help fuel his sorcery.
abilities.declare: Pick either this unit or a visible enemy unit within 12" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
If you picked this unit, allocate 1 damage point to this unit and add 1 to casting rolls for this unit for the rest of the turn (ward rolls cannot be made for that damage point).

If you picked an enemy unit, roll a dice. On a 3+, inflict 1 mortal damage on that enemy unit and for the rest of the turn:

• Add 1 to casting rolls for this unit.
• Add 1 to this unit's power level.

warscrolls.name: Scourge of Ghyran Black Coach
warscrolls.fluff: Thundering through the Ghyranite forests and leaving a screaming trail of ectoplasm in its wake, a Black Coach is both bone-shattering war machine and unholy shrine. Its ghostly attendants screech blood-curdling threats as they brandish swords, tomes and necromantic relics – possessions of the undead tyrant who lies dormant within a coffin atop the great hearse.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: War Machine, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: One Stop, No Return
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Hero Phase
abilities.lore: A Black Coach bears down upon its target at the appointed hour, flaming hoofprints burning the skies. Where it arrives, soul-numbing terror is brought with it.
abilities.declare: Pick an objective you do not control to be the target.
abilities.effect: For the rest of the turn, while enemy units are contesting the target objective, they cannot score critical hits while this unit is also contesting it (hit rolls that would be critical hits score hits instead).

abilities.name: Spectral Carriage
abilities.lore: Unimpeded by physical obstacles due to its phantasmal form and carried upon spectral winds, a Black Coach hurtles towards its victims with horrifying swiftness.
abilities.effect: For the rest of the phase, add 1 to the number of dice rolled when making charge rolls for this unit, to a maximum of 3.

abilities.name: Spectral Attendants
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Hero Phase
abilities.lore: The spectral attendants of the Black Coach bear potent artefacts, usually the possessions with which the occupant was interred. These can greatly empower the coach itself or imbue it with an aura of death magic that invigorates nearby Nighthaunt.
abilities.effect:
Pick 1 of the following to apply for the rest of the turn:

***Noble Blade:*** This unit’s melee weapons, including **Companion** weapons, have **Crit (Mortal)** instead of **Crit (Auto-wound)**.

***Unholy Grail:*** Pick a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit wholly within 12" of this unit. Each time that unit uses the ‘Rally’ command, you receive 3 additional rally points.

***Tome of Undead Lore:*** This unit has **WIZARD (1)**.

warscrolls.name: Scourge of Ghyran Kurdoss Valentian, the Craven King
warscrolls.fluff: Kurdoss Valentian is a malevolent spirit known to all as the Craven King. This mocking epithet belies a cunning mind, for few can rival Valentian’s grasp of strategy and ruthless will to win. His mistress, Lady Olynder, has demanded that Ghyran be drowned in terror and her word is Valentian’s command. Brandishing his great sceptre, he orders his gheist armies into battle, his traitorous legacy inspiring them to commit fell deeds of their own.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Inescapable Mockery
abilities.lore: There is no respite from the unrelenting harassment afforded to Kurdoss by his hated attendants. The only satisfaction that remains to this embittered conqueror is the spectacularly petty obliteration of any lesser enemies he finds himself face-to-mask with.
abilities.effect: Add 1 to hit rolls and wound rolls for this unit’s combat attacks that target an enemy unit that has a lower Control characteristic than this unit.

abilities.name: A Traitor's Legacy
abilities.lore: The continued declaration of Valentian’s horrifically wicked deeds in life can often give nearby gheists particularly grim inspiration of what horrors to inflict upon the living.
abilities.declare: If this unit is in combat, pick a visible friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit wholly within 12" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Pick 1 of the following to apply for the rest of the turn:

***Regicide and Kinslaying:*** The target’s melee weapons have **ANTI‐HERO (+1 REND)**.

***Usurpation and Larceny:*** Add 5 to the target’s control score.

***Sedition and Betrayal:*** Enemy units cannot use commands while they are in combat with the target.

warscrolls.name: Scriptor Mortis
warscrolls.fluff: Should a Scriptor Mortis learn the name of a one who has slighted Nagash, they will note it down, assigning the offender's soul to a fitting underworld. With a final flourish of their quill, the Scriptor can bring their target's existence to a sudden end. The condemned may strive to banish their sinister judge before the sentence is carried out, but given the presence of the other Nighthaunt drawn to the gheist's flickering witchlight candles, this is easier said than done.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Judge, Jury and Executioner
abilities.lore: With a mere flick of a quill, sentenced souls are doomed to be dragged to the underworlds by gheists hungry for vengeance.
abilities.effect: Each time a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT INFANTRY** unit uses a **FIGHT** ability, if all of its attacks target the same **SENTENCED** enemy unit, that friendly unit's melee weapons have **Crit (Mortal)** for that **FIGHT** ability.

abilities.name: Sentenced to Eternal Torment
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Hero Phase
abilities.lore: Once the true name of a judged enemy is recorded, their unending punishment is all but inescapable.
abilities.declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 18" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target and the target has the **SENTENCED** keyword until the start of your next turn.

warscrolls.name: Shyish Reaper
warscrolls.fluff: The soul-hungering Shyish Reaper is the ultimate manifestation of finality and death. This is no lingering premonition of far-off doom, but a screaming scythe that arcs towards its victims with terrifying speed, hewing through their physical form and spirit alike.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Manifestation, Endless Spell, Fly, Ward (6+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Soul Reaper
abilities.lore: A Shyish Reaper is always on the hunt for souls, sweeping through its prey to cleave flesh and rip away the spirit, sending it screaming into the underworlds.
abilities.effect: Add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of this **MANIFESTATION**'s **Almighty Reap** if it charged in the same turn.

warscrolls.name: Spirit Hosts
warscrolls.fluff: Spirit Hosts have but wisps of sentience. They are agglomerations of tormented souls that gather thick around locations or individuals redolent with Shyishan energy. It should come as no surprise that Spirit Hosts are commonly seen drifting alongside the Nighthaunt processions, for wherever the ethereal hosts roam, death and suffering is certain to follow.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Drawn to War
abilities.lore: When the champions of the Nighthaunt muster their processions for battle, Spirit Hosts flock to join their cause, serving as useful fodder for the enemy.
abilities.effect: Friendly **NIGHTHAUNT INFANTRY HEROES** have **WARD (4+)** while they are wholly within this unit’s combat range.

warscrolls.name: Spirit Torment
warscrolls.fluff: Spirit Torments are Nagash’s spectral gaolers. Lords of the Great Oubliette, a continent-sized underworld honeycombed with freezing dungeons and pitch-black cells, they trammel the life force of the slain into the massive padlocks they bear. Escape from these eldritch clasps is all but impossible – it is said they are even able to capture the discorporating energies of Stormcast Eternals before they can return to the heavens.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Captured Soul Energy
abilities.lore: The chains and padlocks carried by Spirit Torments can capture spirits and reshape them into raw amethyst power to aid their minions.
abilities.effect: Each time a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit wholly within 12" of this unit uses the 'Rally' command, you can make 3 additional rally rolls of D6.

warscrolls.name: The Headsmen's Curse
warscrolls.fluff: Condemned by Nagash to wield the dread sword Terminus, the Wielder of the Blade seeks out those mortals that the Great Necromancer has determined to be guilty. No matter their crime, the sentence is always the same – a swift and brutal death. These pitiless gheists accompany the bearer of the sentient blade Terminus on their quest to punish those who have wronged Nagash. There are always three: one to sharpen the sword’s edge, one to bear the headsman’s block and a scriptor to sentence the condemned.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Infantry, Fly, Ward (6+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Furious Indictment
abilities.lore: The Scriptor of the Sentence howls crimes and secrets long thought buried – and none are immune to the harrowing charges brought against them
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit within 12" of this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect:
Roll a dice. On a 3+, the target is **condemned** until the start of your next turn.

While a unit is **condemned**:

• Halve that unit’s Move characteristic.
• That unit cannot use **RETREAT** abilities.
• Subtract 1 from the number of dice rolled when making charge rolls for that unit, to a minimum of 1.

warscrolls.name: Thorns of the Briar Queen
warscrolls.fluff: The Briar Queen was once incarcerated in the vaults of the Shyishan city of Shadespire, locked away for crimes too horrendous to mention. Since the coming of the Necroquake, she has been set loose upon the living, her remit to bring madness and terror to all who would evade Nagash’s punishments. The forsaken entities that trail in the Briar Queen’s wake have become infamous in Shadespire and beyond. Amongst them are the eldritch jailer known as Varclav the Cruel, the noose-throttled Ever-hanged and a ragtag group of evil-hearted Chainrasps.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Unique, Infantry, Fly, Ward (6+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Ghostly Howl
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: There is no describing the shrieking wail of the Banshee; it is so horrific that its sound alone can pierce the soul of any who hear it.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit that had any damage points allocated to it this turn by attacks made with this unit’s **Piercing Scream** to be the target.
abilities.effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, the target cannot use commands until the start of your next turn.

abilities.name: The Briar Queen
abilities.lore: The Briar Queen and her lieutenants once ruled the criminal underworld of Shadespire with a magical fist.
abilities.effect: While this unit’s **Briar Queen** is on the battlefield, it has **WIZARD (1)**.

warscrolls.name: Tomb Banshee
warscrolls.fluff: Tomb Banshees are apparitions of revenge who have dwelt long upon the dark deed that robbed them of their life, love or contentment. A single hate-filled scream from a Tomb Banshee can freeze the life from even the bravest warrior.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Hero, Infantry, Fly, Ward (5+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Cacophony of Sorrow
abilities.lore: The piercing scream of the Tomb Banshee amplifies the discordant shrieks of Myrmourn Banshees, breaking the resolve of even the bravest of soldiers.
abilities.effect: While there are any visible friendly **Myrmourn Banshees** units within this unit’s combat range, ignore positive modifiers to the control scores of enemy units within 12" of this unit.

abilities.name: Ghostly Howl
abilities.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle (Army), Any Shooting Phase
abilities.lore: There is no describing the shrieking wail of the Banshee; it is so horrific that its sound alone can pierce the soul of any who hear it.
abilities.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with this unit to be the target.
abilities.effect: Inflict D3 mortal damage on the target. If any models in the target unit are slain by this ability, the target cannot use commands for the rest of the turn.

warscrolls.name: Vault of Souls
warscrolls.fluff: The Vault of Souls is a spectral chest that hungrily draws into itself the spirits of those slain in its vicinity. Filled to overflowing and ever greedy for more, it eventually burst, violently expelling a storm of frenzied, harrowed gheists.
warscrolls.referenceKeywords: Manifestation, Endless Spell, Ward (6+), Death, Nighthaunt

abilities.name: Soul Eruption
abilities.lore: Should a Vault of Souls glut itself too greedily, the captured spirits within will burst free, tearing at those nearby in their desperation to escape.
abilities.declare: If this **MANIFESTATION** has 6 **soul points,** pick any number of enemy units within 6" of this **MANIFESTATION** to be the targets.
abilities.effect: Roll 6 dice for each target. For each 4+, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target. Then, reset this **MANIFESTATION**'s **soul points** to 0.

abilities.name: Siphon Souls
abilities.lore: This summoned chest siphons souls, filling itself to overflowing with the rich spirits of mortalkind.
abilities.effect: Each time a model from a friendly or enemy unit is slain within 12" of this **MANIFESTATION,** give this **MANIFESTATION** a **soul point,** to a maximum of 6.

rules.name: Lethal Rancour
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Enemy Hero Phase
rules.lore: The gheists of this horde are drawn from haughty nobles and obsequious courtiers who refused to admit fault even at the very end. They rail constantly at their kingdom's doom, and their undying bitterness renders their spectral touch even more deadly against those they perceive as interlopers.
rules.declare: Pick up to 2 friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units to be the targets.
rules.effect: The targets' melee weapons have **Anti-charge (+1 Rend)** for the rest of the turn.

rules.name: Greedy for Souls
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Enemy Turn
rules.lore: A Nexus of Grief’s bricks fly apart and its metal rails extend outwards like a grasping claw, dragging it ever nearer to living, breathing victims.
rules.declare: Pick a friendly **Nexus of Grief** to be the target.
rules.effect: For the rest of the turn, the target has a Move characteristic of 3". It can immediately move up to 3" and can move into combat but cannot end that move on a terrain feature or within 3" of an objective.

rules.name: Petrify
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Enemy Hero Phase
rules.lore: The screams and wails of this procession's bloodthirsty champions are so terrifying that their foes often become rooted in place, ripe for the slaughter.
rules.declare: Pick a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT HERO** to be the target.
rules.effect: For the rest of the turn, enemy units cannot use **RETREAT** abilities while they are in combat with the target.

rules.name: Vanish and Reappear
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
rules.lore: These mercurial spirits are feared for their ability to dissolve into nothingness before suddenly reappearing elsewhere - often right behind their next targets' backs.
rules.declare: Pick a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit that is in combat to use this ability.
rules.effect: Roll a dice. The unit using this ability can move a distance up to its Move characteristic added to the roll. It can pass through other models and the combat ranges of enemy units, and it can end that move in combat.

rules.name: There Is No Escape
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
rules.lore: Death Stalkers are spectral killers that relentlessly hunt down a chosen enemy. They are constantly on the move in pursuit of their quarry and nigh impossible to pin down.
rules.declare: Pick a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit to be the target.
rules.effect:
For the rest of the turn:

• The target can use **CHARGE** and **SHOOT** abilities even if it has used a **RETREAT** ability in the same turn.
• The target can use the 'Retreat' ability without any mortal damage being inflicted on it.

rules.name: Blades of Eternal Rust
rules.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Enemy Hero Phase
rules.lore: The weapons of these Nighthaunt constantly shed flakes of spectral rust that cause whatever physical substance they come to rest upon to corrode in moments.
rules.declare: Pick an enemy unit that is in combat with any friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units to be the target.
rules.effect: Subtract 1 from save rolls for the target for the rest of the turn.

artefacts.name: Amulet of Waking Nightmares
artefacts.lore: This loathsome amulet afflicts harrowing visions on a chosen victim, whose subsequent throat- rending screams allow Nighthaunt marksmen to locate their target no matter where they hide.
artefacts.declare: Pick a enemy **HERO** within 18" of this unit to be the target.
artefacts.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, for the rest of the turn, the target cannot be affected by the ‘Guarded Hero’ ability or the ‘Obscuring’ terrain ability.

artefacts.name: Tombstone of the Penitent
artefacts.lore: This tombstone, chained to the gheist cursed to bear it, begins to burn with spectral flames as the land around them is suffused with deathly energies.
artefacts.effect: Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of this unit’s melee weapons for each non-**FACTION TERRAIN** terrain feature that is being contested by friendly units, to a maximum of 8.

artefacts.name: Stave of Suffering
artefacts.lore: This staff drinks in the misery and pain of nearby living things and converts it into powerful magic that can be harnessed by Nighthaunt spellcasters.
artefacts.effect: While this unit is within 12" of any damaged enemy units or enemy units that have had any models slain, add 1 to casting rolls for friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units while they are wholly within 12" of this unit.

artefacts.name: Brazier of Nagashizzar
artefacts.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared the 'Redeploy' command for a friendly NIGHTHAUNT INFANTRY unit wholly within 12" of this unit
artefacts.lore: Green flames billow from this brazier, lashing at nearby gheists and ensuring that there is no rest for the wicked.
artefacts.effect: If you roll a 1-3 when determining the distance that unit can move, you can use a value of 4 instead.

artefacts.name: Lightshard of the Harvest Moon
artefacts.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Any Combat Phase
artefacts.lore: This lightshard is filled with a baleful gloom that, upon release, casts the battlefield in an eerie glow, readying the enemy for the reaping.
artefacts.effect: If this unit is in combat, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons used by friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units while they are wholly within 12" of this unit for the rest of the turn.

artefacts.name: Mirror of Echoing Failures
artefacts.phaseDetails: Reaction: Opponent declared a SPELL or PRAYER ability for a WIZARD or PRIEST within 12" of this unit
artefacts.lore: To fail in front of this awful artefact is to have those miseries echoed in excruciating detail by a caterwauling reflection of your own face deriding your futile efforts.
artefacts.declare: Pick each enemy **WIZARD** and **PRIEST** within 12" of this unit to be the targets.
artefacts.effect:
Roll a D3. On a 2+, for the rest of the phase:

• Subtract 1 from casting rolls and chanting rolls for the targets.
• Each time any of the targets fails to cast a spell or chant a prayer, inflict 1 mortal damage on that target.

artefacts.name: Talisman of the Nadir
artefacts.phaseDetails: Reaction: Opponent declared a SPELL ability
artefacts.lore: A tiny, spell-eating mote of the Shyish Nadir rages in this ornate hourglass, devouring enemy magics with eager abandon.
artefacts.effect: If a friendly **CLATTERING PROCESSION** unit wholly within 12" of this unit was picked to be the target of that spell, this unit can use the 'Unbind' ability as if it had **WIZARD (1).** Add 1 to the unbinding roll for that ability.

artefacts.name: The Seal of Nagash
artefacts.phaseDetails: Once Per Battle, Your Hero Phase
artefacts.lore: This sigil, magically seared into this gheist's spectral form, binds them to Nagash so that he may readily drain their power to sustain himself at a moment's notice.
artefacts.effect: Allocate 3 damage points to this unit (ward rolls cannot be made for those damage points). Then, **Heal (3)** the friendly **Nagash.**

heroicTraits.name: Ruler of the Spectral Hosts
heroicTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Hero Phase
heroicTraits.lore: The deathly power of this spirit is like a siren call, an unseen signal that beckons to those who have passed beyond the grave.
heroicTraits.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly non-**HERO NIGHTHAUNT** units wholly within 12" of this unit to be the targets.
heroicTraits.effect:
Roll a D3 for each target. On a 2+:

• If the target is damaged, **Heal (X)** the target, where **X** is an amount equal to the roll.
• If the target is not damaged, return a number of slain models to it with a combined Health characteristic of up to **X,** where **X** is an amount equal to the roll.

heroicTraits.name: Deathly Possessor
heroicTraits.lore: In a flash ofbalefire, the Nighthaunt vanishes. An instant later, a nearby foe's eyes glow with spectral power and they lash out at their allies, cackling in a voice not their own.
heroicTraits.declare: Pick an enemy **HERO** in combat with this unit to be the target, then pick another enemy unit within the target's combat range to be the victim.
heroicTraits.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, pick 1 of the target's melee weapons. Immediately resolve combat attacks for the target with that weapon against the victim.

heroicTraits.name: Shadowy Aura
heroicTraits.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared the 'Redeploy' command for a friendly NIGHTHAUNT unit wholly within 12" of this unit
heroicTraits.lore: A pall of gloom hangs over this champion, concealing the movements of nearby gheists and allowing them to ambush their victims.
heroicTraits.effect: For the rest of the turn, subtract 1 from hit rolls for attacks that target this unit.

heroicTraits.name: Silent Overseer
heroicTraits.lore: With a gesture of a translucent finger, this gheist orders those spirits who have fled from their enemies to charge again, heedless of the cost.
heroicTraits.declare: Pick up to 3 friendly **CLATTERING PROCESSION** units wholly within 12" of this unit to be the targets.
heroicTraits.effect: For the rest of the turn, the targets can use **CHARGE** abilities even if they used a **RETREAT** ability in the same turn.

heroicTraits.name: Damned Vessel
heroicTraits.phaseDetails: Reaction: You declared a SPELL ability for a friendly Nagash within 18" of this unit
heroicTraits.lore: With a wretched wail, a gheist's will is temporarily eclipsed as Nagash channels his power through their ragged shape.
heroicTraits.effect: Measure the range and visibility of that **SPELL** ability from this unit instead of that **Nagash.**

other.name: Dark Resurrection
other.lore: The Black Coach's occupant is fed the amethyst energies drawn by the slaughter, fuelling their return to undeath.
other.declare: If any damage points were allocated to an enemy unit by this unit's combat attacks this turn and that enemy unit was destroyed this turn, pick a friendly non-**UNIQUE DEATH INFANTRY HERO** that has been destroyed to be the target.
other.effect: Set up a replacement unit identical to the target wholly within 12" of this unit. The replacement unit can only be set up in combat with enemy units that are in combat with this unit.

other.name: Enemy of the Throne
other.lore: Sent by royal decree against those known to have mocked or derided Kurdoss Valentian, the bolts of the Craven throne Executioners are guided by spite-filled sentence scribed on the mark's death warrant.
other.effect: Add 1 to hit rolls and wound rolls for units in this Regiment of Renown for attacks that target a **SENTENCED** unit.

other.name: Insubstantial
other.lore: Nighthaunt spirits are nigh impossible to land a blow upon.
other.effect: Ignore negative modifiers to save rolls for units in this Regiment of Renown.

other.name: Ghostly Paths
other.lore: Guided by the sorrowful wails of the dead, the Sorrowmourn Choir rapidly traverse the battlefield along unseen pathways.
other.declare: This spell can be cast by the same **WIZARD** more than once per phase. Pick the **Lady Olynder** in this Regiment of Renown to cast this spell, pick a visible friendly unit in this Regiment of Renown that is wholly within 12" of them, that is not in combat and that has not been picked to be the target of this spell this turn to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6.
other.effect: Remove the target from the battlefield and set it up again more than 9" from all enemy units.

other.name: Harvesters of Sorrow
other.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Any Charge Phase
other.lore: For the handmaidens of the Unrequited Queen, only the choicest despair can alleviate their torment.
other.declare: Pick an enemy unit in combat with a unit in this Regiment of Renown to be the target.
other.effect: Roll a dice. On a 3+, the target cannot use commands for the rest of the turn.

battleTraits.name: Ethereal
battleTraits.lore: Nighthaunt spirits can rarely be harmed by blows delivered by those caught in the grip of a spiritual terror.
battleTraits.effect: Ignore negative modifiers to save rolls for friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units, excluding **Nagash.**

battleTraits.name: Sepulchral Apparitions
battleTraits.lore: Like sinister visions intruding upon reality, the haunted crypts of the Nighthaunt shimmer into existence wherever there are souls to be captured and tortured.
battleTraits.effect:
If there is a friendly **Nexus of Grief** on the battlefield, you can set up up to 2 additional **Nexuses of Grief** on the battlefield. Each must be set up wholly outside enemy territory, more than 3" from all objectives and other terrain features, and more than 12" from all other friendly **Nexuses of Grief**.

**Designer’s Note:** *The original* **Nexus of Grief** *is set up in Step 1 of the deployment phase using the ‘Deploy Faction Terrain’ ability. This ability allows you to set up a second and third such terrain feature and is used in Step 3 of the deployment phase, after armies have been deployed.*

battleTraits.name: Ethereal Translocation
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
battleTraits.lore: The Nighthaunt appear and disappear from sight to torment their prey.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** unit that is not in combat to use this ability.
battleTraits.effect: Remove that unit from the battlefield and set it up again on the battlefield more than 9" from all enemy units.

battleTraits.name: Mounting Dread
battleTraits.lore: The keening wails and harrowing shrieks of the Nighthaunt are a continuous assault on the courage of those who face them in battle, until their will to fight has all but crumbled.
battleTraits.effect: Subtract the current battle round number from the control scores of enemy units while they are in combat with any friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units.

battleTraits.name: Ethereal
battleTraits.lore: Nighthaunt spirits can rarely be harmed by blows delivered by those caught in the grip of a spiritual terror.
battleTraits.effect: Ignore negative modifiers to save rolls for friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units.

battleTraits.name: The Speed of Death
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), End of Your Turn
battleTraits.lore: With terrifying speed, the ethereal steeds of the Clattering Procession climb into darkened skies, leaving a steep trail of burning spectral hoofprints in the air.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly **CLATTERING PROCESSION** unit that used a **CHARGE** or **RETREAT** ability this turn, is not in combat and is wholly within 9" of a battlefield edge to use this ability.
battleTraits.effect: Remove that unit from the battlefield and set it up again wholly within 9" of a battlefield edge and more than 3" from all enemy units.

battleTraits.name: Spectral Swiftness
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
battleTraits.lore: The incorporeal cavalry of the Clattering Procession are impossible to surround and pin down.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly **CLATTERING PROCESSION** unit that is in combat to use this ability.
battleTraits.effect: That unit can move a distance up to its Move characteristic. It can pass through other models and the combat ranges of enemy units, but it cannot end that move in combat.

battleTraits.name: Pitiless Reapers
battleTraits.phaseDetails: Once Per Turn (Army), Your Movement Phase
battleTraits.lore: The chill blades of the Clattering Procession flash down and reap a deadly harvest as they pass through the enemy ranks.
battleTraits.declare: Pick a friendly **CLATTERING PROCESSION** unit that passed across any enemy units this phase to use this ability, then pick 1 of those enemy units to be the target.
battleTraits.effect: Roll a dice for each model in the **CLATTERING PROCESSION** unit that passed across the target. Add 1 to the roll if any friendly **CLATTERING PROCESSION Black Coaches** passed across the target this phase. For each 6+, inflict 1 mortal damage on the target.

battleTraits.name: Ethereal
battleTraits.lore: Nighthaunt spirits can rarely be harmed by blows delivered by those caught in the grip of a spiritual terror.
battleTraits.effect: Ignore negative modifiers to save rolls for friendly **NIGHTHAUNT** units, excluding **Nagash.**

battleTraits.name: The Ritual Begins
battleTraits.lore: Nagash's potent spirit anchors itself to a nearby Nexus of Grief, and it is from here that his form shall be remade once more in all its macabre glory.
battleTraits.declare: You must use this ability to set up the friendly **Nagash.** Pick a friendly **Nexus of Grief** wholly within friendly territory to be the **ritual site.**
battleTraits.effect: Set up the friendly **Nagash** within 1" of the **ritual site** and wholly within friendly territory. After you have done so, he has been **deployed.** That **Nexus of Grief** is the **ritual site** for the rest of the battle.

battleTraits.name: Gather Power
battleTraits.lore: Nagash's formidable will gathers magical power to reinvest his divine spirit with corporeal raiment once more. During his unholy resurrection, there is a brief window where he is at his most vulnerable.
battleTraits.effect:
The following effects apply to the friendly **Nagash** during the first and second battle rounds, as shown:

**Battle Round 1:**

• His Move characteristic is'-' and he cannot make pile-in moves.
• He has **WARD (3+).**
• He has a Control characteristic of 1.
• **Alakanash** and **Zefet-nebtar** each have an Attacks characteristic of 2 instead of 4.

**Battle Round 2:**

• His Move characteristic is 6".
• He cannot end a move more than 6" from the **ritual site.**
• He has **WARD (4+).**
• He has a Control characteristic of 5.
• **Alakanash** and **Zefet-nebtar** each have an Attacks characteristic of 2 instead of 4.

battleTraits.name: Unholy Vessel
battleTraits.lore: As Nagash gathers his power, a tiny portion of his godly might is invested in the Nexus of Grief that plays host to his disembodied spirit.
battleTraits.effect: The **ritual site** has **WARD (4+)** and cannot use the 'Hungry Crypts' ability.
